gurmukhi: bwNJ bDU purKu inpuMsk n sMqq huie sll ibloie kq mwKn pRgws hY
transliteration: Baanjh Badhoo Purakhu Nipounsak N Santat Hui , Salal Biloi Kat Maakhan Pragaas Hai ?
translation: Just as a barren woman and an impotent man cannot produce children, and churning of water cannot yield butter.

gurmukhi: Pn gih dugD pIAwey n imtq ibKu mUrI Kwey muK sY n pRgty subws hY
transliteration: Dhan Gahi Dougadh Peeaaay N Mitat Bikhu , Mooree Khaaay Moukh Sai N Pragatay Soubaas Hai ?
translation: Just as a poison of a cobra cannot be destroyed by feeding him milk and one cannot get good smell from mouth after eating radish.

gurmukhi: mwnsr pr bYTy bwiesu audws bws Argjw lypu Kr Bsm invws hY
transliteration: Maanasar Par Baitthay Baaisu Udaas Baasa , Aragajaa Laypu Khar Bhasam Nivaas Hai ?
translation: Just as a filth-eating crow on reaching lake Mansarover, becomes sad since he cannot get filth which he is so used to eating; and a donkey will roll in dust even if it is given a bath with sweet smelling scents.

gurmukhi: AwNn dyv syvk n jwnY gurdyv syv kTn kutyv n imtq dyv dws hY ]445]
transliteration: Aann Dayv Sayvak N Jaanai Gurdayv Sayva , Katthan Koutayv N Mitat Dayv Daas Hai ?445?
translation: Similarly, the servant of other gods cannot realise the ecstasy of serving the True Guru, because the chronic and bad habits of the followers of god cannot perish.  (445)
